title: I'm pissed so let's make a useless thread.
body: Bought a 5 Looting Stars Snowdown chest and guess what, got 4 of the same fucking skin. Thanks riot. Much christmas cheer in my tears of my wasted money, not only that but you're limiting us to 2 candy's per weekend?  I'm disgusted.

replies.body:
Yeah as much as i hate riots business practices you kinda are at fault here.

random is random through and through.

Best you can do is reroll the skins or disenchant them to buy other skins that you unbox.

i agree with mesprit for once, you spent it on a random collectable system. you should feel christmas luck that you got 4 of the same skin, that goes against a few odds. dont complain about bad luck on a random thing, if you wanted a guaranteed skin you couldve bought it.

It is 2 candies per two days of the weekend. For us it was Sunday and Monday instead of Saturday and Sunday as far as I know since I could not get any candies on Saturday, but got them Sunday and now Monday.

With the weekends we get, we will have enough free candies to get the Penguin and Gingerbread icon, but the other two icons that give a special limited time emote won't be accessable without spending some cash to get extra candies. 

Seeing as the emotes aren't forever, I think two free Summoner icons is pretty good.
That's why a trading system for the chest could help heaps. Waiting for Riot to get their head around it.
But then rito won't earn as much money ;)

We can't be sure, because it goes both ways.

And one hand you have peeps who'd stop purchasing because they have traded for the things they wanted.

At the other, you have people who're more encouraged to purchase due to reasons like arranging give-aways, or trading with friends for fun etc.

I mean, trading didn't kill off Valve income, in fact their game economy became massive (so massive it's gone out of hand) partly due to the trading system (though the biggest reason was the marketplace). So I won't say it's such a bad idea for Riot even on an economical stand-point. Considering customer flexibility time and time again, actually encourages spending than they would otherwise.

YOU spent money on league of legends
money that was used to buy a RANDOM collectable
it's nobody's fault but your own
